content.question: If there is an adverse (negative) short-run aggregate supply shock due to an increase in the price of natural resources and the government pursues no policy to address the supply shock, then which of the following will occur in the long run?

choices.label: Nominal wages will fall with no change in the natural rate of unemployment.
Inflation will rise and nominal wages will fall.
Deflation will worsen and nominal wages will rise.
Aggregate demand will increase to restore full employment.
The long-run aggregate supply curve will shift right and increase unemployment.

content.answer: Nominal wages will fall with no change in the natural rate of unemployment.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
